description: A shrine was discovered as part of a large Romano-British settlement. The shrine provided rare evidence of the presence of stone pine, a kernel being found in a pit inside the shrine.
bibliography: Booth, Bingham, and Lawrence. “The Roman Roadside Settlement at Westhawk Farm, Ashford, Kent: Excavations 1998-9.” Oxford Archaeology Monograph, 2008.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Westhawk Farm, Ashford (Kent).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
